Huntington Beach, CA 6/28/2012 Couldn't even tell you how the food was because we were never seated!! People told me not to come here for my friends birthday, but I wanted to because of the location and I didn't want to drive to the one in Newport Beach.
Traffic was bad so we arrived exactly 15 minutes after the reservation was scheduled. When she finally acknowledged us, it was barely 20 minutes after our reservation time. Because she didn't get to us in time, she said she gave away our table because check in time according to her watch was when she was able to wait on us (we checked in with her side kick right at the wire, but she was spineless and wouldn't say a word to the nazi reservation girl).
Needless to say, her attitude and the way she spoke to me was a total deal killer. I wish I had her name so I could let everyone know how poor her customer service is. I will NEVER EVER go to this location ever again. I should've listened to everyone who told me not to go.
Bottom line is if she had treated us with respect, we would've stayed and waited for the next table. Someone needs to give this girl a lesson in customer service. Two thumbs down to the chunky brunnette who works the front desk and a big "boo" for the chick who wouldn't tell her we checked in.

Los Angeles, CA 6/1/2012 1 Check-in Here I have to say, the parking to this place probably saves it a couple of negatives in itself. Parking is really easy and right in its own parking structure. Which is good, cause when you're a few minutes late to a wedding, every step closer to the ceremony is a welcome thing.
So yeah, I came here for a wedding. Open bar - awesome. But the food was pretty much a one way ticket to tummy troubles. Which, if you haven't been paying attention, means that this wedding made me feel not so fresh later.
But hey, it was a wedding - by the sea - which should be on the bucket list of everyone for one of their marriages to start off that way. Waves crashing on the sand. In fact, that's probably the best thing about this establishment, the extreme closeness that it shares with the sand and ocean out in front of you.
If you're paying more money for anything, it's for the fact that you just got your shoes wet and you enjoyed what is one hell of a view from the glass windows -- But yeah, the food pretty much is a stinker.
As for the service, it was alright. Not really much to be expected. I think the view you get when you're here is top notch -- just wish the food was better, or for that matter wasn't pricey for what you're paying for -- the god damn view of the beach.

Torrance, CA 5/14/2012 I will echo Boris S's sentiments about his Mother's Day dining experience at this Chart House location. I entered my comments on Landry's website as well.
The service last night was abominable at this Chart House. We had a 6:00pm reservation with a party that included small children. We were not seated until 7:45pm. The management of this location did NOTHING for the customers waiting over an hour to be seated for their reservations, and they had a waiting area full. The hostesses merely assured the customers that the restaurant was not taking "walk ins" that evening. They also provided the convenient excuse that it was not their "fault" that we had almost a two hour wait. Their reservation system never stopped taking reservations. No one wants to hear that when they don't have bread or even a drink for their hungry, cranky children.
To add insult to injury, the hostess was rude when she finally did seat us. When she gave the excuse again about the reservation system, my mother replied that typically management should check their reservations the week before a holiday and see potential issues so the staff is prepared for any issues that may arise and possibly mitigate them ahead of time. At no point did the hostess apologize. In fact, after my mom's comment, she became confrontational back with my mom and then proceeded to glare at my mom as she passed by seating other customers! It was unreal! I felt like someone was going to jump out and say we were on an episode of "What Would you Do!"
Our server was good and empathetic in light of the circumstances, because as you would expect, the kitchen was backed up too. Not only did we wait almost two hours for our table, but we waited 30 minutes for our main course once our order was placed. Needless to say, there are seven people that won't be back at this location! Happy Mother's Day!

Capitola, CA 5/13/2012 Completely disappointed. (Happy Mother's Day!)
To start: We had 5:30pm reservations... we are not seated until 5:50pm on a table that was empty at 5:20pm when we arrived. We did not receive any bread and/or drinks until 6:20pm. When you have a 2 year old with you, that is known as "torture".
The waiter reminded me of a VERY PUSHY USED CAR SALESMAN. He pushed this specific Red Wine on us 5 times, when we refused the recommendation... he disappeared for 20 minutes. He pushed a specific dish on us 4 times, and he made the table uncomfortable was not taking his recommendation. He also tried to get us signed up on the "frequent" buyer club... we needed to say "no" 5 times before he stopped pushing it on us.
When he did take our orders, he "poked" my mother on the should and stated, "okay, we will start with you". (unacceptable)
The $50.00 Alaska Crab Legs were not fresh... about 1/2 of the meat was in them. (I would highly recommend not ordering!) They provide the necessary utensils about 5 minutes after receiving my meal.
The Fillet was substandard, and very expensive.
The empty plates kept on piling up on our table, so I was forced to placed 8+ of them on the floor to make room for other items. The waiter got mad at me for doing this. (Maybe he should have come by earlier and asked to take them after he refilled out water glasses and wine glasses?)
The Hot Lava cakes was a huge disappointment for $15. The chocolate was suppose to flow out of the middle??? It didn't. When I mentioned it to the waiter, he jokingly stated that everyone must have eaten before I had a chance to take a bite and completely minimized my complaint.
At $67 per person, this was the worst value for the money that I have experienced in 10+ years.
I remember when the Chart House was the Best of the Best. What happened?
Great View, substandard food, and THE WORST service imaginable.
Save your money, eat at Denny's. The food is better, the service is much better, and price is right.

Los Angeles, CA 6/21/2012 my memory is a little rusty as my visit was about six months ago (dec 30) when i went on a first date. valet-parking only, so minus a point for not having an alternative to people who would rather park their own cars for fear of valet incompetence or embarrassment of having a sh*tty/messy car.
thankfully it was romantically lit (dim) so i didn't feel that self-conscious, but not dark enough that you would trip over yourself. the restaurant was not very crowded but we had to wait a few minutes before being seated, because our table was right by the window with an ocean view. we took this opportunity to have a glass of wine each by the bar.
it was nice to have the ocean view, unfortunately it was extremely foggy that night (marine layer?) so you could see the sand and a little bit of the ocean. it seemed like a perfect setting for a horror movie really. i like horror movies though, so i took it in stride.
the bread was just ok, not my favorite and not fantastic. we had the artichoke to start off. it was warm and garlicky - all the makings of a great first date appetizer. i'm pretty sure i got the garlic (again!) panko sea bass which came with creamed spinach. the creamed spinach wasn't too heavy but wasn't particularly creamy either. i enjoyed it nonetheless. i really liked the sea bass, it was simply done, nothing fancy but delicious.
we shared a creme brulee which was pretty standard, perhaps it had a little strange flavor to it but i might be making this up (it's been a while).
our server was friendly and attentive, and made us feel right at home. no complaints there.
must have been a good first date despite the garlic-ness, since we're still dating.

San Diego, CA 5/15/2012 1 Check-in Here I've now had two below average experiences here. I would definitely not recommend going to this restaurant.
The second to last time I went to Char House our soup arrived luke warm and the surf and turf with filet minion and lobster was not only lukewarm but the lobster was mushy.
The last time I went to Chart House, I thought I'd give it another try for Mother's Day. I made a reservation for 5:45 and when we arrived (at 5:45) the hostess told us that we probably would not be seated for at least 50 (fifty) minutes. She said that they were "busier than they expected". She wasn't sympathetic, didn't apologize and honestly, seemed like she really didn't care at all. I get that she was probably getting quite a few dissatisfied customers and that the fact that Chart House clearly overbooked wasn't her fault, but at least making it seem like you cared a little would have been nice.
At the end of the day, Chat House overbooked - by a lot. To give you an idea, the parking lot was completely full to the point where people had to park at a separate location and there was a line of cars waiting just to get into the lot. The waiting area inside the restaurant was completely full and the bar was packed at least two people deep. I felt like I was at a club trying to fight for a drink. But, according to the hostess, the restaurant didn't overbook, there were just a lot of tables taking "longer than expected to eat dinner". Come on, just tell the truth.
The bottom line is that there are so many other great places to spend your money (potentially less money) and get much better food and service. Don't waste your time here.

Torrance, CA 5/14/2012 2 photos 1 Check-in Here My family of 9 came here to celebrate my Mom and mother-in-law for Mother's Day. My husband made reservations at 12pm, but we waited 15 minutes before sitting down. I'm not going to be too picky about the wait since it was Mother's Day and I knew that a lot of people were out celebrating.
When you make a turn onto their street, keep driving straight until you hit the parking garage. They offer valet parking for $3.50. I don't think they should be charging for parking since we are eating at the restaurant. Or maybe at least offer a discount if you're dining in the restaurant.
The restaurant is located at the border of Hermosa and Redondo Beach. You've got the view of the beach wherever you sit. Where sat though, we also had a view of the sewage. Not the nicest thing to see while you're eating. Anyway, our waiter quickly asked us for our choice of drinks. My dad was really hungry and wanted something to munch on quickly, so I requested for their house bread. Our waiter must have been really busy because I had to ask twice for it.
To the food we go: I ordered their clam chowder for my starter and their fresh Herb Crusted Salmon with mashed potatoes for my main dish. I LOVE their clam chowder! It wasn't too creamy, too salty, or too fishy smelling. It came in this cute miniature hearth pot. And it went so well with their sourdough house bread! I almost couldn't eat my main dish because I devoured all of it! My brother said he had ordered the Herb Crusted Salmon before and raved about its sauce. I was so excited to try it that it was the first thing I tasted. Unfortunately, I didn't have the same experience as he. The sauce was too salty for my taste. The salmon was a bit dry, so it would've been nice to have something to moisten it :/
I would definitely come back here again for their clam chowder!

Los Angeles, CA 5/1/2012 I was debating how many stars to rate this place... i mean if i put into consideration that i didnt pay the bill then maybe pushing my limits it wouldve gotten 2.5 stars, BUT ohh im reviewing this place based on the aspects of price+quality to be more realistic.
Valet parking only, 5 bucks + tip if youre feeling spendy.
It was a party of 5, reservations at 7pm, hoping for a table by the window to enjoy the sunset. Well table by the window didnt happen but close enougth.
The place was completely packed!! They took our drink orders rigth away, i had a glass of riesling (first of 4 to be precise) for round 6dll or 7dll each, Ohhhoh wait i had a bloody mary first but it was just ok, not really spicy or well made, thats why i swiched to wine :)
First time i open the menu :O :O :O LOL im glad not spending a penny here, so basicly all main entrees are round 30 bucks each, i ordered the NY steak medium, no appetizer or anything else.
The other people at table had the salad bar and my friend ordered lobster bisque, he had to send it back cause it was cold! i actually tried it cause i thought he was just been a dick but i guarantee you it was cold!!!! the funny thing tho is that it comes in a neat looking metal bowl/serving thing covered with a lid that is suppouse to keep it hot! hehehehe, what a joke, i had to add also that flavour wasnt good, it was sweet.
Ok so they replaced the soup it was hot this time, he ate it but said it wasnt that good, all the other people said the salad bar was good, hmmm dunno i didnt go over n see the veggies to make a statement. By now place is getting louder and louder n service is getting slower and slower, took forever to get refills or the waitress attention for that matter.
Sunset was cool, i thought the keep the ligthing low so you can see the sunset better but it was like that all night long! it was too dark for my taste, but since i had a bottle of wine i guess i didnt make a huge deal out of it at that time.
My plate arrives n is this huge pretty piece of meat and a side of mashed potatoes. It was actually medium rare not medium like i ordered, hmmmm i ate the edges avoiding the red rare, i mean i was already half done with the steak i just didnt feel like sending it back and waiting again,mashed potatoes were just ok.
2 lava cakes for the table, wich was for me the best part of the meal! on the menu it says please allow 25 minutes for preparation, it indeed took around 15-20 minutes but it was worth it! it was this warm, moist right out of oven chocolate volcano with chocolate lava, top with vanilla icecream, mmmmm we almost lick the plate! hahahaah that is how good it was!
Took so long to get my last refill on wine, service sucks! imagine if i had send my steak back!!
It was around 350dll not including tip for 5 people; 5 entrees,1 soup, 3 salad bars, 2 lava cakes, 12 drinks or so, not bad if youre not paying! LOL, (the person who invited everyone likes the chart house so i guess it wasnt bad for him)
Two stars were given for: awesome views + lava cake!
*So that night i only ended up paying 10dll for two bottles of wine at raplhs after dinner, hahahahaha im so cheap :) not bad considering just my drinks at pricey house were 35 bucks.

Littleton, CO 4/2/2012 I went to Chart House with my friend who lives in the apartment building next store, another friend and her husband, and their baby. We were starving and in the mood for seafood so we thought we'd give it a try (despite living there for the past year and a half, my friend had never been). The atmosphere is nice--dark and cozy with a great view of the ocean.
We came in on a Friday without a reservation, so we ended up sitting in the bar area. Not ideal, and it took a long time to get our drinks and appetizers in, but our waitress was very friendly and it was our fault for not calling ahead. We ordered the crab mango avocado stack, the hummus trio, and the "best of" soup trio for appetizers. The crab mango avocado stack was fresh and nicely presented, although I didn't expect the crab to be prepared as in crab salad, with mayonnaise and everything. The hummus trio was all right, and the clam chowder in the "best of" soup trio was great. (The lobster bisque tasted too strongly of sherry, though, and the gazpacho was just like eating salsa, which wasn't what I expected.)
For dinner, we ordered a burger and fries, the "best of" shrimp (crab stuffed shrimp, shrimp scampi, and coconut crunchy shrimp), and the filet mignon. The "best of" shrimp was pretty good, and the filet and the mashed potatoes it came with were yummy as well. Not sure about the burger and fries--the pickiest one in our group ordered it and seemed to like it just fine.
We got dessert to go--my friends tried the hot chocolate lava cake and I had a fruit crisp. The fruit crisp had kind of a weird savory taste to it that I didn't really like, but I think my friends liked the cake.
I would probably go back to Chart House again, but I'd order some different things next time.

Riverside, CA 4/24/2012 I went to the Chart House in Redondo last night for the second time in the past few months. The first time was mediocre and so I thought I would write a review since my second time was even worse than mediocre. To start with, my party of 3 ordered a bottle of Camus - $135 (and preceeded to order 2 other nice bottles afterwards). The waiter would walk by our table with empty glasses and not refill our wine so I had to lift up the huge decanter to fill our glasses. My water was empty almost the entire dinner without refill. We ordered the artichoke appetizer and the waiter made a big deal about how HUGE it was going to be - well, yes, it was on a big plate but it was a regular to smaller than average size artichoke. It was tasty, but i am confused as to why he said it was so big. If they had just put the sauces in dipping bowls and it wouldn't take up so much room on the table??? For dinner, I ordered the Surf&Turf with Filet Medallians - i asked for the peppercorn sauce on the side (because i do not like pepper). Apparently, that is how they cover up the fact that their meat is DRY. I asked for it medium to medium rare - the waiter specifically said that medium would be pink throughout and that medium rare would be red. My meat was pink - but very light pink and in my opinion it was medium well. They offered to bring me AuJus to moisten it up - even though I made a big deal BEFORE ordering it that i did not want overdone meat! I've cooked filet on my own without any sauce that has come out more moist. I ate it with the AuJus but it was not at all what I would expect to get at a Chart House restaurant. I had debated going to Kincaid's down the street because of its reviews and will likely check it out next time. I was VERY disappointed with the entire meal and the service from what should be a classy restaurant over looking the water. The one thing that was good was the chocolate lava dessert. But too bad I had to wait until the end of my meal to get it.
Go somewhere else.

El Segundo, CA 12/22/2011 Overpriced, poor quality, slow service.
The only redeeming quality of this place is the view of the ocean that you might get if you get a table close enough to the right window.
I've found myself at this place two times in the past year, with different groups. Folks keep planning small and medium sized events here because, many years ago, Chart House was a classy, high profile place. In all three cases the consensus was "never ever come back here again."
In my most recent experience, an international group planned a dinner here. It was a medium sized group event -- about 20 folks. The reservations were made well in advance and we had our own room. The restaurant was otherwise almost empty and there was a large number of staff. I don't know what they were doing, but they certainly were not waiting on us.
I paid $57 for an exceptionally low grade filet mignon, prepared medium well in spite of my request for medium rare. It wasn't just me. Most of the party commented on the low quality of the food, especially for the price. The waitress taking our order was abrupt and unaccommodating. The food took an extraordinary amount of time to arrive. After it was finally delivered, no one came to check on us until desert.
The most frustrating part was getting out of there. After the meal we had to wait half an hour just to get the bill, then another 20 minutes for the server to bring it back. Even then he messed it up and took it back to "recalculate."
Other folks have had good experiences here from time to time. But with so many great ocean view places in Redondo Beach, why gamble on this one?

Redondo Beach, CA 3/10/2012 I'm giving this a 3 I think out of nostalgia and the food was still good. I have been coming to the chart house since I was a toddler. I have spent numerous birthdays and other occasions here.
My boyfriend wanted to take me here for my birthday with some friends since he knew how much my family loves it. He made the reservation online and we were seated right away when we arrived.
They have done away with self parking but what do you expect? Most places in the area make you valet.
It was a Tuesday so it was very quiet but when we walked up to our table a man (I'm assuming the manager?) got very close to my friend and said "brandy?" in a kind of your in trouble sort of way. She looked at him a little afraid and pointed to me to which he said again "brandy?". I said yes even though he kinda creeped me out and he replied "you sit here" and pointed to a specific chair.
I understand that they wanted to know who the birthday girl was but the way he did it made me like I was in grade school and in trouble!
We laughed it off and went on to menus. They had printed my name and happy birthday on our menus which they usually do... Makes a girl feel very special! Some 20 minutes later a waiter came out and asked for drinks. Now I am all for a long dinner but I get thirsty! Another 15 minutes goes by and all of a sudden the waiter hits me in the head with a tray of our drinks!!!!! My glass of wine tumbled over my head and somehow missed me and ended up everywhere. How I was not covered in red wine I don't know. The look on my boyfriends face I almost felt bad for the guy and he apologized so I tried to let it go.
ANOTHER 10 minutes go by and he brings out everyone else's drinks but mine! Really?? I have a lot of patience but this was starting to get ridiculous.
We ordered the steamed artichoke (my favorite!) and the calamari for appetizers. The artichoke was great as usual but the calamari was cold.
The waiter almost seemed like he had never waited tables before. He never offered to fill up our drinks and had to be asked numerous times and even then we would wait forever for them. He finally brought our food and it was all very good. I had the short rib and mashed potatoes. We ordered the green beans (think they're called jasmine maybe??) and they were amazing. We also preordered the lava cake which is always great (the mud pie is my favorite though).
Then it took an unbelievable amount of time to get our bill. (which was in no way adjusted for the tray of drinks incident).
They did nothing to recognize my birthday, now I'm not saying I expected anything but why did the big creepy guy ask who I was and demand me to sit somewhere?? So he could make sure the tray of drinks was spilled on me?
All in all the service was horrible, view was great, food was decent, but I may reconsider the chart house as my go to. Don't know if the view is worth being covered in wine anymore.
